description:
This is one of my favorite places in SF! Better still, one of my favorite places ever. The food was amazing and the service was warm and welcoming. Thank you, Chris for being such a great host. 

This place is so good that I went there on back-to-back nights on a recent work trip. Everything I had was superb, and it's really not like me to write good reviews (you can tell by all of the reviews that I've written). 

I'll definitely be back the next time that I'm in town!
author: Khoa N.

description:
One word describes this awesome restaurant for us.

Gnocchi!!!!!!

OK. The rest of their food and their service is also super good. After the insanely good gnocchi appetizer (we each had our own serving - ain't gonna share that stuff with nobody LOL!!), my wife had risotto and I had osso buco. Both were the bomb! This is probably our favorite restaurant in San Francisco!
author: Tom K.

description:
An absolute gem of a restaurant.  Exceptionally delicious contemporary Italian food made with love and dedication.  Very attentive and warm service. A romantic ambience to enjoy dinner in a quiet and intimate setting.  The menu prices are also quite reasonable for the high quality of the food and level of service.

I generally avoid North Beach when dining out, though it has a handful of good restaurants, there are far too many mediocre tourist-traps and the nighttime scene is crowded and touristy. Da Flora is definitely a compelling reason to go to North Beach. The small restaurant sits at Filbert and Columbus on the edge of the North Beach commercial district, so while it is in a very picturesque part of the neighborhood, it is somewhat off-the-beaten path of the main "restaurant scene," making it relatively easy to get a table and avoid the annoying crowds.  

The menu changes regularly and focuses on fresh, farm-to-table contemporary Italian cuisine.  So, you will find unique new entrees as well as new variations of classic dishes.  Truly, everything from the appetizers to the desserts were flavorful, excellently prepared, beautifully presented, and delicious.  We were warmly greeted and seated promptly, we received excellent service throughout the meal, we actually got a large table for two with plenty of space around it, and we could hear each other talk!  After so many dinners shouting at each other over the noise one typically experiences in SF restaurants, it was terrific to be able to have a pleasant conversation. The whole dining experience was wonderful, and we look forward to going back.

I highly recommend Da Flora for delicious, lovingly prepared and beautifully presented food served in a romantic and intimate setting with excellent service.
author: Christopher B.

description:
Super cute little restaurant we stumbled upon Halloween night & the decor was very fitting. Walked in without a res & were seated instantly around 7:30 

Our server was very attentive and made excellent wine recommendations, he was great! 

After checking yelp for recommendations we started with the sweet potato gnocchi. They were soft little puffs of heaven in a creamy sauce with baconnnnn . We used the bread to dip in the sauce because it was soooo delicious, give me more! It's not a huge portion, but a nice way to start the meal. We also shared the Caesar salad and sole dish. I'm not the biggest fan of Caesar salads but the server convinced me it was mild. It's a lighter dressing and fresh salad, but a little too anchovy-y for me.. the bf loved it though ! The sole is a very small portion, but cooked well.. the Meyer lemon sauce it comes in is wonderful , make sure to drizzle it on top of everything. Has a side of greens and crispy potatoes. 

The menu is handwritten and kind of hard to read, it took a while to figure it out. 

We would definitely go back & we're happy we found this little gem.
author: danielle a.

description:
An amazing experience! Our group of seven enjoyed ourselves immensely. The wine was delicious, great recommendations from Christopher. Originally we ordered one sweet potato gnocchi, it was so fantastic we ordered two more. We opted for Family Style and shared the Cesar and the Butter lettuce salads. These were good but the entrees were the standouts, Risotto, Crepes, Orrecheti Pasta. All the dishes were prepared with a wonderful blend of flavors and texture. 
We'll definitely be back on our next visit to San Francisco.
author: Cathy L.

description: The wine we had was from Italy which was absolutely delicious! Second favorite aspect of dinner was the sweet potato gnocchi - I wish they made this an actual dish, though it might be too much. The sauce was absolutely delicious I basically cleaned the plate with the focaccia bread they provide. The main dishes were also very good, my date and I shared. The ambiance is great and it isn't too crowded like most San Francisco restaurants. I'd definitely recommend it for a date night - it's the perfect place!
author: Nesha P.

description: We had the pleasure of dining again last night at DaFlora. With out a doubt it is one of San Francisco's best restaurants. The food is not run of the mill Italian. All three courses we ordered was amazing. The wine we ordered was recommended  by our outstanding server Christopher's and was absolutely delicious as well.
author: Colienne B.

description:
1. I never right reviews. 
2. Probably the best restaurant I've ever been too, the owners were amazing, attentive and had an amazing selection of wine. If you are in San Fran. You have to be there.
author: Steven A.

description:
Found this place by mistake.   Small , Great food. Very fresh
Service was a bit slow but I suspect it's a family run business so there was no rinse. And we were not in a hurry either!
Will come back in a heartbeat next time I'm in San Fran
author: Cecil W.

description: Nope, it's not the way it used to be. So disappointing. I had some of the best meals here over the years but this time the magic was gone. Pasta bland and tasteless. Risotto not cooked right and too oily. Dessert so-so. Coffee good. We took leftovers home but never touched them. They went straight to compost bin. I'm not sure what changed after the place was sold since the chef is still the same. I don't think I can go back and pay so much for something so mediocre.
author: Rude G.

description:
O M G !!!! What a pleasure was to enjoy Chef Jen's McMahon delicatessen food, she has the love for cooking and is projected in every single dish that she prepare to detail. My husband made reservation two months in advance and I am telling after enjoyed my meal I would say that I do not mind to wait again for another wonderful meal at this cozy place, on top of it, the service was marvelous. We started with Crostini, then Cesar salad, the main dish were: House made tagliatelle and Manicotti. Wine selection met my husband's wine connoisseur.
I had the privilege to add  a picture of Chef Jen and myself to my collection gallery, also I will share with her website.
author: Patricia S.

description: Menu is very small so look it over before you eat here. The service was good and it's a quaint little spot but the food was just ok.
author: Kris L.

description: Fantastic little gem that we stumbled upon on our trek back towards our hotel from Ghirardelli Square after gorging ourselves. Although we weren't very hungry, the menu in the window spoke to me. It's a very small menu but I found several things that looked delicious and unique, and for a vegetarian, that's saying a lot. I was full but I just had to have the watermelon and cucumber salad. I really enjoyed it and am determined to recreate this light and fresh dish at home. My husband had the squid ink pasta and enjoyed his immensely as well. I only wish I had room for more as I would have loved to try the sweet corn and carmelized onion pasta that caught my eye. Overall a very intimate and quaint place, didn't seem like a tourist trap at all and the service was very welcoming and efficient. On our next trip back I would definitely plan to return.
author: K A.

description:
We cannot wait to come back. We were going to a comedy show down the street and were looking for a place to have dinner beforehand. We're so happy to have stumbled across Da Flora-A. 

It's a smaller, intimate restaurant and it was obvious they put a lot of care into its design. Everyone who works here is incredibly nice and helpful. We talked through a few wine options and settled on a bottle that was fantastic. The focaccia was amazing and we'd probably come back for this alone, but our mains sold us on here for life. He had a seafood dish and I ordered the pork tenderloin. Both dishes were some of the best that we've had in a while.
author: Colleen M.

description: I had the pleasure of dining at this beautifully decorated corner restaurant in lovely San Francisco. First of all the atmosphere when you walk in makes you feel at home which instantly made me feel welcomed. The owners are so pleasant and genuinely nice that you feel like you're having dinner at your friends house. Our server was Saul and he was so attentive and gave great recommendations. I started off with the sweet potato gnocchi and I can't even describe how amazing it was! The main course I had the duck risotto and it was out of this world. I can't wait to come back and try more of these well balanced and decadent dishes. You can tell they cook with pride and passion.
author: Sfqueen85 ..

description:
Intimate, old school setting that makes for a great romantic or even family spot. It's a husband and wife team now with a limited staff supporting them. You feel like you're cared for here. Reservation are highly recommended as I've seen a lot of walk-ins turned away.

Gnocchi appetizer (5/5) - this is their signature. The sage, sauce and bacon come together harmoniously.

Vegetable soup (3.5/5) - a fine rendition though nothing remarkable. They are nice enough to split up dishes for 2 though.

Squid tagliatelle (4.5) - very tasty with a healthy filling portion. Noodles are perfect texture and squid is perfectly cooked.

Veal Bolognese with bucatini (4/5) - not too heavy and very tasty

The quality is always good but what really wins you over here is the charm with the handwritten menus updated frequently and the staff. The pasta is among the best in SF and is not fussy or pretentious - this place doesn't focus on what's trend and instead delivers what is classic. It's a good value for the quality and I am always happy to make a trip to eat here.
author: Victor W.

description: We were in town only an hour when we stumbled upon this place. The salad, the gnocchi and both of our main courses were amazing...like clear your plate amazing. Darren was an amazing host and his wife (the chef) created both beautiful and phenomenal dishes. We were too full for dessert, but if it is anything like the courses, it will be incredible as well. We loved it!
author: C K.

description:
Man. I dined here back in 2005 and think about the place still. Warm, cozy, romantic atmosphere. The owner knows her shit and will personally recommend pairings. The gnocchi... my god, the gnocchi. I have compared every single gnocchi experience to Da Flora since. The dessert... I don't recall what we had (c'mon, it was 12 years ago!) but I do remember being so very pleased that I chose to opt in, even though I'm not a dessert person, per se.
I love Da Flora, and am always very happy to see it is still in business.
author: Bernadette M.

description: Went there the other night. What a fantastic restaurant. The decor was unique with a cozy red interior and a Venetian theme. Felt very classic San Francisco. Great service by one of the owners, Darren. The food and wine were delicious, plentiful and very unusual. The chef, Jen, is the other owner and is the magic behind the food. We had the sweet potato gnocchi with bacon. Unreal. Had a very fresh salad, a spaghetti with dungeness crab. Wow. And shared the sea scallops, cooked to perfection. Loved the salty focaccia bread. Wine recommendations paired perfectly, and all Italian selections. Definitely a gem to come back to.
author: Blake Y.

description: Authentic venetian food, prepared well and served with a smile. The couple that run this restaurant are just lovely, and they've refined the art of creating an experience over many years. This place is especially good for a date. Conversations can be had without too much background noise.
author: Ash F.

description: I can't believe we just found this restaurant.  I feel like I missed 20 years of fantastic Italian food.   Great date place.  Cozy with super friendly staff.   Darren made some excellent recommendations (gnocchi, scallops, and the risotto) and they were ALL excellent.    We can't wait to go back and try the squid ink pasta!!!   Look out for our return!!!
author: Seth T.

description: I've eaten here many times and it is consistently outstanding. Definitely try the gnocchi and save room for their desserts. Everything is homemade, wines are reasonably priced and service is excellent.
author: Lisa K.

description: Wonderful service & the food was delicious! An authentic gem among many of the more cheesy north beach Italian restaurants. Great for a romantic night or special occasion of fine dining. It is a very intimate space with a cosy feel. We will definitely be back!
author: Sarah I.

description:
My husband and I wanted to eat out somewhere in the neighborhood on Friday night and after throwing a few ideas around, Da Flora popped into my head. Even though it's an incredible restaurant, it can be easy to overlook it because it's located at the very end of the "Italian restaurant" section of Columbus. Right off the park, it's an adorable spot on the corner that almost looks like an old antiques store from the outside. We've eaten at Da Flora once before after a recommendation from my father, and had a wonderful experience. I can't recall everything we ordered, but I do remember telling the server that my mushroom risotto was the most authentic risotto I'd ever had outside of Italy. 

We walked in around 7pm without a reservation and were immediately sat at table by the door. The decor/vibe of the restaurant is so warm and welcoming. I love all of the random art and antiques around the restaurant; it feels like my crazy Italian aunt's dining room in southern Italy. The server, who is married to the chef (and is also the co-owner of the restaurant), is incredibly friendly and attentive. Their menus are handwritten, as its constantly changing, and served in these adorable Venetian menu books. They also have a very reasonable and  interesting wine list; both times we tried a wine that we were unfamiliar with and were pleasantly surprised. This time, we tried a Schaiva, which is a light-bodied red wine that tastes like Pinot Noir. It was delicate and light in color, and I will definitely start looking out for this wine. We had a difficult time deciding on two starters/appetizers since they all sounded delicious, but we ended up picking the smoke prosciutto and melon dish (bursting with flavor), and the sweet potato gnocchi, which is an absolute must; they were the lightest and fluffiest gnocchi I've ever tasted. They also brought deliciously oily focaccia to our table (and we definitely asked for seconds). For our entrees, I ordered the braised chicken thighs with summer squash and crisped polenta. My husband ordered the orecchiette with roast eggplant, Calabrese sausage, and toasted bread crumbs. Both dishes were exceptional. The chicken was perfectly cooked, and the different textures of the squash and polenta really completed the dish. 

By the time we finished our entrees, we were totally happy and stuffed. The entire dining experience was intimate and relaxing, and the final bill was very reasonable given the quality of the food. We will absolutely be eating at Da Flora more often!
author: Regina L.

description: Love this place! The food is delicious. I love the sweet potato gnochi as a starter. it's also a great place to have a romantic evening once the sun has gone down.
author: Maria M.

description:
This was our second time to Da Flora, the first being a few years ago while we were planning our wedding in North Beach. The experience was so memorable, we decided to head there rather than checking out a new place (I know, this is not standard behavior while traveling). 

While our memory of Da Flora was epic and I would have sung it's praises until the Venetian cows came home, this time fell just a bit flatter than we expected. 

I had the mushroom manicotti, which was actually more of a crepe than ravioli. It wasn't bad, just a completely different texture than I was expecting. However, really amazing mushroom flavor and the cheese was creamy and delicious. While the flavor was good, the portion was tiny. The carpaccio and the caesar we ordered were super tasty, but nothing out of the ordinary for a high-class Italian restaurant. 

One thing we noticed was that there weren't very many meat options on the menu at this time. I understand that this happens when a restaurant changes around their menu regularly, but I felt the balance was a bit off in this experience. Everyone raves about the gnocchi (what my husband had last time), but it wasn't on the menu this time and he was a bit disappointed. 

Finally, because it was late August and the restaurant doesn't have air conditioning, the wine was a bit warm. It's stored in the restaurant, not in a fridge, so it was definitely a reflection of the temperature in the room. For the price of the food and drink, a wine fridge is definitely something they might want to invest in. 

I'm not sure I'd be in such a hurry to come back after this experience, but it'll definitely still be on my radar if I'm in the area.
author: Kristy C.

description:
I can't believe I have not reviewed this one. This restaurant was featured on Cheak Please in 2006, the episode previous to the episode I was  a guest on (My pick wasTown Hall).

I have been there maybe 4 times now in the last 10 years. It used to be a challenge to get a table and that cranky old lady ran the show.

I was there last week on a rainy Saturday night, and I will say the room has seen better days and I shudder to think how garish it looks in daylight. The interior walls are painted bright red and the paint is peeling in a number of places.

No cranky old lady in sight, we had a nice waiter - who started out great, then when it was time to get the bill - he disappeared for about 15 mins. My man and I split their famous gnocchi and the slow braised pork.  

In a super sad twist of events they did not have their famous pistachio cake (which almost out them one star on this review) But what can I say I have a soft spot for this place.
author: Amy W.

description:
It's small.
It's intimate.
It's Venetian.

I honestly don't think you can possibly go wrong w anything on the menu here.  From salad to dessert, the dishes here are poetry.  The gnocchi are tender morsels of heaven, & the sauces are true studies into what Venetian dining is all about.

It's obvious that this restaurant is a labor of love for the 2 owners.  These ladies have successfully brought their dream of carving out an authentic replication of Venetian dining to life.  

Every aspect of the space, from the warm & rich red walls & the dim lighting, to the fresh flowers & other personal touches, accentuates the experience of a superb dinner.  It's unique & simple.  

There's elegance in simplicity.  

Da Flora is the epitome of a neighborhood gem.  Reserve a table, & revel in the experience.

5 stars.
author: Veronica M.

description: Wow this place did not disappoint!  From the quaint size and intimate feel, great service, and outstanding food.   The appetizer bread was yummy and well worth the price of free.  I had the lamb, wow!  All in our party of four were very happy with their meals. I have never eaten a plate so clean.  The pasta and prawns, great.  And the crepes with ham and white sauce yowza!
author: Ron B.

description: One of my favorite Italian restaurants in the neighborhood, and the neighborhood is full of Italian restaurants! The food is excellent, handmade with love by the husband and wife owner team. Don't miss the sweet potato gnocci starter. Clever twists on classic dishes with a seasonally-changing menu. The restaurant itself is romantic and lovely, but not huge, so reservations are a good idea, especially on weekends and during the summer. Skip the kitchy Italian sidewalk joints and head here for the real deal!
author: Erin M.

description:
This is the epitome of a perfect ristorante. The beautiful, intimate lighting, candles, antiques, classic paintings,  rustic tables & walls painted deep crimson are perfect. The really cool music is lovely. I give it 4 stars not 5 because it is ridiculously overpriced. If they would adjust to provide reasonable prices, I would come here once a week instead of once a year.
 We ordered the fish (cod) which was tasty-- arugula, lemon, garlic aoli. In a disappearing San  Francisco, where neighborhoods are losing their unique character, Da Flora is a blessing.  The service was impeccable, so what these idiots have said on yelp should be ignored. The perfect neighborhood restaurant, not cheap but nearly worth every penny. Elegant yet comfortable & casual. Check it out.
author: Scott F.

description: Went there with out of town friends that we had enjoyed our food and great services. All the dishes that we had ordered we're fantastic. Money was well spent.
author: Michael C.

description:
Food 4.5/5 stars
Service 2.5/5 stars
Ambiance 3.5/5 stars
Value 3/5 stars

Here's the ugly, I think this place only has good service for the regulars. Hubby and I came here for date night, we asked for water, water didn't come. 2/3 way through the dinner, we were able to make eye contact with a waiter and got our water. And our water was not refilled. It just sat there empty and sad. The place was around half empty so there's no excuse for that. Also, we still had 1/3 bottle of wine left when the bill came and the waiter told us to "take our time". In around a minute, another waiter came and took our bill away to the register when we didn't even have the chance to put our card in. From what I read in other reviews, that's around what I expect from the service.

Now onto the good part, the food. We shared the sweet potato gnocchis with bacon, the squid ink pasta with baby squid and the pork chops. The gnocchis were lovely, the cream sauce was divine and I wish I could lick the plate. The weird thing about the dumplings is that some were a lot lighter than others, maybe they were from different batches. Regardless, with the sauce, I could dip cotton balls in there and it would still be fabulous.

The pasta dish is probably one of the top three pasta dishes that I've ever had. It's so simple, with freshly made squid ink pasta, impossibly tender baby squid and a simple tomato sauce. All the flavors just pop and the texture of the fresh pasta (perfectly el dente) and the squid, wow, just wow.

The pork was very tender and juicy, surprisingly so, in fact, because just looking at the coloring of the meat, I thought it might be slightly overcooked, but it was oozing with juice and flavor. The meat was perfectly caramelized and just so good. The celery cake tasted a bit funny. It was slightly gummy. I couldn't decide if I liked it or not because I love celery root but the texture of the other starches in the cake made it unpleasant. 

I'm always a food over service kind of person. Considering the prices here, with around $15 apps and $22 pastas and $26 secondi dishes, I would think the service should be better, but the food overcomes the shortcomings. The atmosphere in the restaurant is what I saw in mom-pop places in Italy, very homey and it was actually pretty quite. I think it's a great date spot because the lighting is good and the bottles of wine are fairly priced, too (average around $50 a bottle). Overall, I enjoyed my experience and would come back, however, if you value server as the most important factor in your dining experience, I would avoid this place at all cost.
author: Alice W.

description: I am so mad! We walked by this place for YEARS saying that we would eat there but we never did. Until Now. So why am I mad? Because the place is wonderful and we could have been having great meals there over many years. What a terrible missed opportunity. Oh well, we will just have to make the most of it and eat there often to make up for lost time. The owners couldn't be more friendly and welcoming. The service is efficient but not intrusive. The food is fantastic with creative touches and well balanced flavors. The deserts are not to be missed. I especially like the fact that the noise level is low so that normal conversation is possible. This place is terrific and I can't wait to go back.
author: Lee D.

description:
A very unique romantic experience. The ambiance is romantic and the food exquisite. It appears that no nights have same menu, therefore leading me to 2 conclusions. 1) food is fresh 2) chef is an artist. Both very demonstrated in our experience.

We had carpaccio, pork chop, sea bass, orchetta, and then some! All flavors and textures just as pleasing as the next.

The service was of diamond quality.
author: E M.

description:
Wandered in by chance. Magically got a table on a Saturday night. Superb food. Charming, kind service from both staff who helped us. Nice wine. Sweet ambience. Very happy. I wish I lived here so I could return. Thanks for a lovely evening.
My daughter adds these emojis:
author: Amy H.

description: This must be our 10th time eating at Da Flora's and have never written a review but feel compelled to comment on the consistently amazing food, service and intimate, romantic atmosphere. This is like no other North Beach restaurant, everything in Da Flora appeals to our senses. It's comfortable, quiet and full of old world charm and elegance. The food and wines are just magnificent. We never feel rushed, hovered over or pushed to leave. And, I can't forget to mention the extraordinary foccacia and desserts. This restaurant is a one of a kind and we love it!
author: James F.

description: Wow! Darrin and Jen have a great thing going with da flora. We try to avoid touristy places when traveling, and we hit the jackpot with this place. Some of the best bread I've ever tasted, sweet potato gnocchi was out of this world as was the veal manicotti, pork chop, duck leg agnolotti, dessert, crostini, all 3 salads and short but nice and reasonable wine list. Neighborhood, intimate, quaint, fabulous food, wonderful, flawless service and a fantastic experience! Will be back next year!!!!
author: Jake O.

description: Such a fabulous, luscious experience celebrating my 60th birthday here...chef and co-owner Jen McMahon lovingly prepared each of our dishes x 5 people, and it was outstanding: Sweet potato gnocchi, sherry cream and smoked bacon or sage; Orecchiette, Calabrese sausages, broccoli rabe, toasted breadcrumbs and extra virgin olive oil; Manicotti , crepes stuffed with spinach and ricotta baked Il forno in a wild mushroom , leek, and pecan pesto cream and aged provolone; Spaghetti with fresh cracked Dungeness crab, Uni cream, caramelized fennel, chili flakes mand eyer lemon zest; additionally, we all had classic Caesar salads, to die for !...fresh focaccia was ever present and delicious...the Chef's husband welcomed us with warmth and open arms....the ambience is delightful, Venetian red walls and lovely art everywhere...soft golden lighting made for a very intimate and special experience....conversation between us all was easy and easy to hear...the delightful waiter and host tastefully attended to our every need...some of us had wine, and their list has a wide array of wondetsul choices from smaller producers in Italy...topped off the meal with some Moscato and an espresso - heavenly...thank you Da Flora for creating a wonderful memory ! BTW, if you have not been here, you must go !
author: Nancy C.

description:
I am giving only two stars because the food and atmosphere were truly unique and enjoyable. Very well-priced wines representing different styles, delicious main courses and desserts.

Too bad the service was very inattentive. It almost seemed like we were in the middle of a nightmare where everyone thought we were invisible. Yet, we were still clearly there.  Nobody bothered to refill our wine, dishes were sitting at the table for another 20 minutes after we were done, dessert was finally served after another 15 minutes of wait, credit card took only 10 minutes to get run. I almost thought I would see some additional charges from eBay on it the next day...

Needless to say, service should be something that makes you feel welcomed and interested to come back again and again. This will probably not be the case for us...
author: Vi V.

description: Loved!  We had a great dinner here.  Food was wonderful and the service was very efficient.  Staff was very friendly!  Thank you for a great night!
author: Alexandra M.

description: This place is a hidden gem.  It is so intimate and has hands down the BEST gnocchi I have ever eaten and let me tell you...I have eaten a lot of gnocchi.  Do yourself a favor and go here!!
author: Bryce D.

description: So so so good!! Definitely a do over - beet salad and butternut squash risotto - amazing!! The owner was very attentive to our table, from seating next to the window (we requested) to making sure we had plenty of fresh focaccia bread (it's also delicious) love the atmosphere and location. We will definitely be back - it's my new favorite spot in the city!
author: D J.

description:
Perfect. Casual surroundings in a small space filled with great wines and warm souls. And the food is incredible: I send others to Da Flora as the gnocchi is the best I've ever had along with tasty, imaginative salads, yummy focaccia, fabulous pastas and delish desserts. Last night's pear crisp and raspberry brown butter cake were heaven.
Yes, service may be relaxed, but both Mary Beth and the young gentleman waiter were so warm and caring (Mary Beth found aspirin and specific tea for a pal). And, yes, we had to ask for our check, but I love being able to sit and relax and enjoy our great meal with great friends. How lucky can you get?!
author: Angelique V.

description:
One of the best places to eat in North Beach
Fresh menu delicious cooking great atmosphere out of this world focaccia! Eat drink and be merry 
I luv this little red gem
author: Robert S.

description:
Way too expensive for what you get. I would never go back.
The room was lovely and the food was decent...food 2.5 out of 5 stars.
I eat out at all types of restaurants and eateries from taco trucks to French Laundry...I don't usually feel compelled to write reviews but the casual attitude and price of this place was just bizarre. Casual: we asked if there were wines by the glass and the server (owner I believe) said "we open a few bottles" then rattled off names with very little information. "There's a red blend that's very good" so I asked what was the blend "I don't know, a bunch of southern grapes I could yell them out to you" Fine so we ordered 2 glasses. I have no idea who produced the wine, the price or what was in it...she couldn't be bothered to tell me. Bizarre.
In the end we ordered the Gnocchi appetizer, a Caesar salad, a child's pasta, 1 Risotto and 3 glasses of the mystery wine. The bill was $120. Seriously? 
There was nothing spectacular about the food, service was sloppy and it's way overpriced.
author: Lisa W.

description:
I was here with a friend. The food was really good, but the host was really rude and gave me the feeling that I didn't belong there with my friend. 

When I asked her questions about the food, she was really short. Really kind of dampened the mood for the amount of money I paid. 

I hope she reads this and improves on customer service.
author: Paul C.

description: Amazing, fresh, Sicilian food, in a cozy, romantic atmosphere. Chef Jen and her husband Darren are doing right by the legacy of Da Flora.
author: Anna T.

description: Gosh, what a great place!  Ambiance, food, wine , etc. all top notch.  Casual dining, low noise level. Lucky to have found this place!
author: George S.

description:
I had high hopes, but I was remarkably unimpressed by Da Flora. My friend and I split a salad and a couple of pasta dishes. Everything we had lacked seasoning. We had to ask for lemon and add salt just to feel like we were tasting something. Service was lackluster, despite there being only a few active tables in the restaurant. Overall, the experience was fine, but certainly not worth the price. 

There are a lot of wonderful Italian restaurants in North Beach, but this is not one of them. I suggest you save your money and dine elsewhere!
author: Shania T.

description:
**3.5 STARS**

Another impromptu siblings dinner with our new sis-in-law in tow =)

Note: there is a parking garage across this place...

Sis chose this place... and upon walking in... literally... we all thought it was Hogwarts. Yes we're that dorky! The place itself was very foggy inside... windows were fogged up and my bro's glasses fogged up upon walking inside. Plus, the decor was red and they had two candles standing by the doors. 

We got seated right away (PLEASE make sure you make a reservations sine the place itself is "cozy" and they turned away customers quite a lot...)

It was dark... so we had to really look into the menu... as a designer... the menu was very hard to read because it wasn't very legible. It's one of those fonts that looks cool on screen but upon printing on paper... useless. 

Their foccacia bread was to die for! It was homemade... perfect blend of freshness and the salt on top... delish! We ended up asking for refills... thankfully they gave it to us! 

Their menu was limited and that's always a 50/50 thing for me... I ended up getting the gnocchi for my starter ... and that was delicious! It literally melted in my mouth and my sis kept dipping the bread onto the sauce... it was my favorite dish for the night. I ordered a risotto for my entree...  it was eh... and a tad salty. It didn't really wow me... compared to the rest of the my siblings who loved all their meals. 

We ordered the whole dessert menu... and again the siblings loved them but I was okay... so-so with them. I guess I just wasn't feeling the sweets that night.

Overall... the staff was so-so... food... I guess I'll have to go back to try a different entree... definitely worth checking out though. 

PS: they say on their menu that they "prefer cash"
author: Cath M.

description: This is possibly my favourite place to eat in the city. Whenever i come here i am never disappointed. I had the spaghetti with anchovies today and it was sublime. So fresh and light handed. Perfect.
author: Prerona M.

description:
the food is super delicious, so there are the two stars.

The owner, Flora, was rude to us and mocked me, to my face, for ordering water with my meal.

not nice.
author: Deborah H.

description:
Da Flora is the best Italian food I've ever had (outside of being in Italy) and some of the best food I've had in SF period. My Dad discovered this gem a while ago and we've been going here as often as we can ever since. 

Flora and Mary Beth (the women who run the restaurant) are there almost every night and are a wealth of knowledge on all things food and wine. Flora does all the wine selections and most of the dinner menu. Mary Beth makes all the desserts and the focaccia. The focaccia is literally out of this world, it's hand made daily and beyond delicious, I could eat pounds of it. Their gnocchi is also the best I've ever had, it's so light and fluffy. All of their pastas are phenomenal as well. Every single item that comes out of that kitchen is made in house and truly delicious. 

The menus are hand written weekly, as they are always updating the menu depending on what is in season. Flora and Mary Beth both take so much care in this restaurant and it's one of the better dining experiences you will have in San Francisco. That being said, Flora take a bit to warm up :) she's pretty no nonsense but  knows more about food and wine than you can imagine. 

I would suggest going here with a small group (no more than four) the restaurant itself is small and intimate. The tables are always full so make a reservation ahead of time. If you are looking to have an incredible dining experience with the most amazing food this is your place.
author: Lizzy U.

description: I went here last night with a group of 7 for a birthday. Every dish was fresh and absolutely delicious. The gnocchi was incredible and my boyfriend keeps saying how he could have eaten that dish endlessly. Darren was very attentive, helpful and provided great service. This restaurant has wonderful ambiance, it's small and tucked away from the other touristy Italian restaurants. Thank you Darren and Jen for a terrific meal and experience, we will be back! - Alissa
author: Alissa H.

description:
My girlfriend and I went to Da Flora for the first time tonight to celebrate our 6 month anniversary! 

The ambiance is unlike any other italian restaurant in San Francisco- it feels genuinely locally Italian. It is romantic and has a lovely charm. 

The food is fantastic, we shared the gnocchi to start and had the risotto and tagliatelle after. Both we tasty and presented well. 

The service from Darren was first class- Darren was attentive, knowledgable and so friendly. He even ran our after us when we forgot something! We will be back very soon!
author: Paul J.

description: The best italian food in all of San Francisco!  Incredible service and presentation and it also feels like you're in a romantic European brasserie.  Get the gnocci as an appetizer, you will come back again and again to taste this perfection!
author: Kris G.

description: This is a bit of a hidden gem. A piece of old school Little Italy if you will. One of my college friends swore by it and dragged me here retty much ever since they opened. I think it's evolved a bit. Nowadays the gnocchi/bread are the stars but back in the day I remember having a great carbonara. It's rare that an Italian place in NorCal will focus mostly on an area and the Venetian bent here makes it worth going to for that regional flare.
author: Kim N.

description:
Our experience was excellent. My date really loved her food (stuffed artichoke, gnocchi) as did I (Arugula salad, Spag w/ Veal) and the bread was heavenly. Dessert was great as well. Wine was excellent and reasonably priced (Lagrein, $46). Service from Darren was expert. Mary Beth assisted as well, and we discussed bread making (my new hobby). Flora, the owner, took our order and was pleasant. When we walked in at around 5:15, the place was empty so we had no issue getting seated at a nice window table. 

We noted that the place filled up quickly. This place has quite a following, and you can tell that they are regulars. This is a cozy space - 10 tables in the configuration that evening. 

The portion sizes are good and the food is wonderfully rich - such that I had a bit left over. Had it the next day and still as delicious as the day before. My date said the same of her gnocchi and bread. 

I will return for sure.
author: Edward W.

description:
I've been going to Da Flora for ten years and in all of this time has never failed to delight.  Favorites are the sweet potato gnocchi in a garlic cream sauce starter. The squid ink risotto is always good, and they are one of the few Italian restaurants to put liver on the menu - last visit I had chicken livers, cooked to perfection.  

The staff is knowledgeable about the wine list and how it pairs with food -  every meal I've had there, I can say the wine enhanced the evening, and without fail they always recommend something affordable, not the most expensive bottle on the menu. 

I've brought guests from Mexico, from New Jersey, Texas and France, and every one of them has loved it and vowed to come back.

It's super romantic looking inside, only 9 tables or so.
author: Sandra M.

description: I just ate one of the most delicious meals ever!!! Seriously, phenomenal food. I had the speck to start (thin sliced prosciutto with artichoke hearts). It was delicately delicious!!! I had a salad too (butter lettuce with apples and nuts and addicting dressing). We also tried the gnocchi appetizer with gnocchi and bacon, and gnocchi and sage for the vegetarians at the table. I don't even have words for how delicious this was. Last but not least, I had the spaghetti with mushrooms. Pasta cooked perfectly, light cream with extremely palatable and pleasing oyster mushrooms. I cannot wait to come back here. It was a work dinner but felt like a good old time. The owners of the restaurant are very friendly and the vibe here is very welcoming. You come here to eat well. This place is no joke. Tonight, this became one of my favorite restaurants - period. Can't wait to come back.
author: Nancy S.

description: Of course, the gnocchi is a must.  The wine list here is a lot of fun and you can get great advice/tips on the selection.  This is a cute place with great food, the menu is hand written.  Cards are accepted but the menu specifically notes that cash is preferred.
author: Janelle C.

description:
Excellent gnocchi.  We appreciate that they were able to accommodate a party of seven on short notice.  Proprietress was very pleasant.  
Chairs squeal piercingly on floor when moved, an annoying, unpleasant, tiring sound.
The menu had no dishes with meat that are not cholesterol heavy.  My pappardelle with duck leg was too fatty & greasy for my stomach.  I suppose I should have had the one non-meat dish.
The wine list seems expensive.   Lots of wines from Eastern Europe, the least expensive being $58.  She suggested an organic California red blend that I did not enjoy.  
We did not know it is cash-only until we read the bottom line of the menu.  Fortunately, We had $363 in cash for appetizer, one salad,seven entrees, three glasses of white wine and the bottle of red blend.
author: Terry R.

description:
I have been daydreaming about this pasta since I had it last weekend. We ordered the sweet potato gnocchi (dinner portion) and the pappardelle. Both were so fantastic! The gnocchi had a great ratio of filling to dumpling dough and great flavor. The pappardelle tasted incredibly fresh, had a nice bite to it and had a really good sauce too. The bread they brought with our meal was good, even better when used to sop up remaining sauce.
We had great service. I'm not really sure what to make of all the mixed reviews here but we thought the service was friendly and efficient. We didn't order much and we were still treated with respect and friendliness.
author: Felicia B.

description: Delicious food; highly recommend the gnocchi if it's on the daily menu. Everything about Da Flora was like a home cooked meal. Waiter's wife was the chef, he talked us through each dish as if he'd made it himself. Very small place, welcoming setting. Great food, great people, great time.
author: John C.

description:
I love this place but seems like lately I never know when they are open.

You can tell everything is freshly made and definitely feels like a neighborhood place to go to dinner. Gnocchi is def the most memorable to me.
author: Karen S.

description: Friday night, party of 4, 8pm. Da Flora ha a beautiful room, very very good food, and the service was attentive enough for us. We were mostly left alone to catch up among ourselves, but someone always appeared to pour wine, clear away dishes, check in. Loved the watermelon salad, the heirloom tomato starter, the gnocchi and the little gems with figs. The manicotti was amazing and I loved my heirloom tomato and corn risotto. I hope to return soon, to leave room for dessert!
author: Kimberly M.

description: Wow, best meal I've had in a long time.  Bread alone is worth the trip and breaking of my gluten free diet!  Nothing is GF but so delish!  Had the house gnocchi and pork chop!!  Loved every bite!
author: San Carlos B.

description:
My husband and I went to Da Flora for a date night. We were travelling around SF and just stopped in the city to go to this place due to the innumerous good reviews. We had booked in advance (2 weeks before) and when we got there the lady/owner told us we did not have a reservation due to her calling the wrong number the night before to confirm.  Even though she called the right number the night after we made the initial reservation. So, we were left standing in the front door with no explanation about what was going on. Worst than that, she made it seem that it was our fault that she called the wrong number in the second time. 
Finally, we got our table and because we were driving to another city that night we didn't order a bottle of wine. It was the worst mistake! After that we were treated even worse than the beginning.
The food was ok but nothing special except the sweet potato gnocchi. Summarizing, we don't recommend this place and we won't ever come back! For this price, the service must be way better and friendlier.
author: Ana S.

description:
Sadly ... or experience had some extreme highs and lows. I cant recommend the place.

Positive: Service (truly amazing!!), Gnocchi, Spinach Salad, decor and the feel of the space

Negative: all our main coarse dishes were poor.
author: A'lan A.

description: Excellent food and great service.  I had the crepes with veal in a Bolognese sauce.  I thought I died and went to heaven.  My friend is a vegetarian and had the gnocchi.  She said it was the best!  Also shared pear tart for dessert.  The crust was nicely toasted and the pear was delicious. Highly recommend this place
author: P S.

description:
This is a fantastic, intimate restaurant with delicious food. From the hand-written menus to the cool decor to the great staff, da Flora proves to be a neighborhood gem you need to check out. 
 We lucked out and got a table without a reservation, but it's probably best to book ahead. Home made focaccia bread is delicious and we enjoyed it with the Caesar salad. I had the halibut and my husband had the spaghetti with mushrooms - both were perfectly cooked. The portion sizes are reasonable - not over sized - and we both finished our meals. Save room for the homemade desserts - the chocolate cake was heavenly. 
 When the whole restaurant (maybe 12 tables) joins in to sing "happy birthday" to patrons on two separate occasions you know it's a friendly, yet intimate environment. We'll be back.
author: Debbie C.

description:
I must admit that the first time I visited Da Flora I was not that impressed but I had a good enough time to return. The second time around everything fell into place. It's that kind of place. It takes a little getting use to. The owners are very friendly and the their recommended wine was great. I can't remember what it was but the four of us had three bottles.

The menu is a little unconventional mixing antipasti, salads and small pasta dishes under the label "primi."  What put them in this category was that they were small and suitable to be eaten first. The second category "secondi" included meat dishes but also  pasta for those that wanted that to be the entree. Makes sense to me. My tomato salad had the best tasting tomatoes (July) I've tasted in a long time. The sweet potato gnocchi were heavenly. the zucchini pappardelle with ricotta were unforgettable. Since I passed on the dessert, I have it on the authority of my guests that they were exquisite. Looking forward to my third visit.
author: Gasper S.

description:
Every year all the women in our family take a trip to SF for a night of Christmas shopping. There is usually at least 12 of us and we all go out to dinner after a day of shopping. We typically book our reservations several months in advance since it is a busy time of year and always make sure we find a place that can accommodate our large group.  
Upon calling Da Flora, we spoke with one of the owners and asked if they had an opening and if they could accommodate such a large party.  The woman was very sweet and assured us it would not be a problem.
When we arrived to our reservation we were pleased to walk into such a charming place. 
We were greeted by another woman, who apparently was the other owner of the business, not the person we spoke to on the phone months prior.  Now our group was understanding that this is a small establishment and that taking on such a large party as ourselves isn't easy and service may not be all that quick - we were all perfectly content with that because we were there to relax and enjoy each other's company with a good meal. 
To start off on somewhat positive note - The food was good but had a bit too much garlic and salt. A few of the members of our party could not finish their meals because there was way too much salt and garlic. But we all tried each other's dishes and the food was over all very tasty.
However, this was all dwarfed by the unbelievably rude woman who was waiting on us (she said she was one of the owners). We are all a very polite group - we don't fuss over little things and we are not a demanding bunch, we are not loud or obnoxious, so the behavior towards us was baffling and very unsettling. 
While eating our dinner and talking to one another, we noticed on several occasions the owner standing there staring at us and rolling her eyes.  Most of us didn't think anything of it, until she came over to us to clear some of the plates she continued to roll her eyes at us.  We did not say a thing to her and did not discuss the matter until we had left the restaurant, but this attitude is not okay.
 As I mentioned before, there were 12 of us and so we ordered 3 or 4 bottles of wine for the table - even though we were drinking wine, we were at no point heavily intoxicated or obnoxious patrons. But, at one point a couple members in our party wanted to have another glass of wine with their dessert.  When asking the owner for some wine by the glass (which they serve) she rudely refused and stated she didn't want to open another bottle.  Feeling like we did something wrong, we said okay and just had coffee.  
We finished dessert (which was delicious) and all of us feeling very unwelcome and received the bill from the owner who seemed to be even more disgruntled at this point.  Tip was included in the bill which is standard so it was easier to calculate how much was owed per person.  After counting the money (several times to ensure everyone gave enough) we ended up putting down a few dollars extra - the bill was something like $497 and we put down $500 so we didn't have to break any bills and could just get out of there.  So - even though we paid with tip included in the final bill we also left $3 over. We went outside to wait for the cabs that we called and the owner comes out in a huff saying we were $11 dollars short. What???? If we paid $500 and the bill was $497, how were we short?  We tried asking her but she just kept saying we were short.  Finally, some members of our party very frustrated at this point handed her the money just to get her away from us - if she is hurting so bad for that $11 just have it and leave us be.  
A couple walked into the restaurant as we were leaving and were turned away by the owner because she told them "we cant serve anyone else tonight, we don't have enough." It was only 8:30...
We will NEVER return. If it was such a hassle to accommodate our group, we would have completely understood if they told us so when we asked them when we called months prior to make our reservation. Also, to the owner that served us that evening, you are the face of your business.  If you are so miserable that you have to treat strangers in such a horrible manner then maybe you should stay behind the scenes as the owner rather than serving your customers because clearly you do not know how to treat people respectfully.
author: L R.

description:
Pulled in by the great ambiance.

Everything else was horrible. Bad service. Bad food. Terrible wine (only 1 option for red or white by the glass). Overpriced. People walked in and were told with a nod and frown, "sit over there." Asked us, "do you drink water?" We said yes. They didn't bring it. Such a waste!
author: Marlene T.

description:
This has been my favorite Italian restaurant ... and favorite overall restaurant ... in SF for several years.  Both are big statements, and Da Flora lives up to them easily.

Flora and Mary Beth will take care of you once you come through the door for your reservation (book one).  Ask them for suggestions, let them pair the wines, have some fun with your meal.

There will likely be a Hungarian dish on there owing to Flora's heritage, there will aways be sweet potato gnocchi (order it), and the bread they throw in for free could be an appetizer unto itself (I'd pay for it).

Want a guaranteed great dining experience?  Book Da Flora.
author: Nathan S.

description:
Around the corner from where we live, the folks at da flora put out lovingly made food that's delicious but probably not low-cal (bacon gnocchi to die for). The place is warm and inviting and definitely not a tourist trap.

Note that are cash-only!
author: Serena S.

description: Food here is wonderful. As went after seeing an old episode of check please. We had the scallops, carpaccio and the risotto in roasted tomatoes, all were excellent. Service was great too. Very accommodating, gave me s pillow for my back and gave us a great table in the corner. A tad expensive, especially for a vegetarian dish but I understand it's San Francisco and real estate and other isn't cheap and the food was delish, so we will return nonetheless.
author: Traci H.

description:
I've had my eye on Da Flora for awhile now - I live in the neighborhood and I keep reading and hearing great things. I decided to take my parents here while they were visiting.

It is on the corner and not very well marked so make sure you know where you are going! Also make sure to make a reservation, there are only a few tables and on Saturday night they were turning people away. 

The restaurant itself is tiny, candlelit and welcoming. It would be perfect for a date.

They have an extensive wine list but only one white and one red option by the glass. I went for the red, it was a Sangiovese and actually complemented my meal well. I love that the menus appear to be handwritten and even though its a small-ish menu there are a wide variety of choices. 

My Dad and I each got the endive salad which was a fresh start to our meal. I loved the spiced pecans and the champagne vinaigrette dressing. For our entrees, Dad went with the crab fettuccine which he loved and I went with the pork tenderloin. My pork came with a fennel fritter and an amazing whole grain mustard sauce. 

For dessert we shared a Torta Veneziana which is a buttery pistachio cake with creme anglaise. So so good. All of the dessert choices sounded delicious and I wanted to order one of each.
author: Sara P.

description: Intimate dining experience. Gourmet menu! Fresh and delicious. Oh, fantastic wine too! Enjoy!!
author: Shelley S.

description: The food is delicious - fresh, homemade pastas and great all around Italian dishes with spot on flavors.  The wine is well selected and reasonably priced. The owners are friendly and on site daily - cozy atmosphere and a little off the beaten path. I've been here three times and it doesn't disappoint.
author: Tom M.

description: Walked in to get a quick meal as recommended by someone I was staying with. I was not greeted when I walked in despite a staff member looking me directly in eye. I asked for a table for one and was told to take a seat. As I was just pulling out my chair, another waiter came and told me I would need to wait 45 minutes as they would like to fill the restaurant up with groups instead. It is a small restaurant, but there had to be at least 6-7 empty tables. I have never been refused service for being a single customer - when I told the waiter I will look elsewhere he shrugged his shoulders and just said "yeah, probably". It was embarrassing and I do not recommend this place at all - judging by other reviews they are clearly just a Money making machine and do not value the importance of their customers' experience. Zero stars.
author: Amalia C.

description:
Oh my stars, this was good, good, good.

I dined here the night after eating at the much-raved about Aveline (which I liked) but Da Flora was  better.  Started with the sweet potato gnocchi. I wanted to be sitting a vat of those luscious little pillows of perfection. Also had the special tomato salad with focaccia. Also, majorly good.  For dinner two of us had the Ling Cod on Shrimp cake special and the other diner had the risotto with pancetta and mushrooms. So, so good. We used the provided fresh focaccia to wipe our plates clean. And then came dessert-- a butterscotch pot de creme that almost made me weep and chocolate bomb of some sort that looked almost too good to eat. Almost. We got over it and devoured it.   The meal, the atmosphere, the odd photo over the bathroom sink...it all worked for me so well that I tried to get a reservation for the next night to take another friend but couldn't get in. Alas, I must return to the west coast.  Thanks to Chef Jenn and Darren for creating a meal and night to remember!!
author: Amanda H.

description:
I've been meaning to review this place for a loooong time.  We went here last summer after multiple glasses of wine at a tasting place in the Ghirardelli plaza.  Ended up walking from there based on the bartender's rave review and he was right on the money.  

Really liked the character of the place, the handwritten menus were so cool and I remember everything we got was tremendous.  I kinda wished we were a bit more sober to be more detailed about the food we got but the blur of the whole evening somehow made it even more special for the both of us.
author: Philip T.

description: This is consistently one of the best restaurants in North Beach! The sweet potato gnocchi is divine and the focaccia bread is delicious. I have never had a bad meal here and the atmosphere is cozy. The staff are so nice and Jen and Darren are the best! Love this place!!
author: Susanne B.

description: My husband and I recently moved into the neighborhood and a friend suggested we try this restaurant. I'm so glad we did. It's everything you want in a neighborhood restaurant - great food, nice ambience and friendly staff and owners. The gnocchi and focaccia are amazing and our main dishes were delicious as well. Looking forward to our next meal there.
author: Brooke T.

description: Great place! The food was excellent. The staff is so matter of fact. It's hilarious. Loved the atmosphere.
author: Erin H.

description:
I've been coming here for years. Cozy, romantic restaurant with tables spaced acceptably. 
Most people come here for the Gnocchi and for good reason, soft pillows in an exceptional sauce.
Most of the rest of the menu is quite good too.
The ladies running it aren't friendly by a long shot but are also no-nonsense and don't linger at your table too much so it's a good place for intimate conversation.
author: Nancy G.

description: What an amazing little restaurant!! Great wine, food was absolutely amazing, and the atmosphere is just perfect! Most of the bad reviews are from people who are WAY too picky. This is must try restaurant!! It won't disappoint!
author: Justin C.

description:
Da Flora is possibly my favorite restaurant on the planet. Da Flora has all the elements of a great restaurant; excellent food, great service and a very cool atmosphere. I've read all the reviews on this page and can echo all the positive reviews. Da Flora was recommended by a local who was pouring wine at Wattle Creek tasting room (another great place). He told us it was the best food in town, so we tried it. He was 100% correct! 

On our first trip the owner waited on us. She was great!! Her recommendations of appetizers and wine were perfect and her personality won us over immediately. We talked with her and other staff members during our evening and had a great time. We were sold. 

A year later my wife and I were in SF and went to Da Flora again. When we walked in you would have thought we had eaten there every week. Everyone there remembered us a year later! How many places can you make two visits to, a year apart, and have the staff remember you? That's how Da Flora is. Some reviews call it quirky and maybe it is. But it's comfortable, friendly and a great place to eat.

We have plenty of world class restaurants here in Vegas. Restaurants with names like Flay, Legasse and Batali attached to them. Da Flora is easily in the same class with any of them and in my opinion, Da Flora beats them all!

BTW, try the sweet potato gnocchi! I don't care for sweet potatoes but this dish was beyond incredible.
author: Lou D.

description: The best restaurant in the West Coast!  Flora is such a great host -- no winning and make sure your cell phone is off though... Trust her with the wine selection.  The gnocchi are out of this world!
author: Javi N.

description:
Like others have said, I don't want to give away this little secrete of Da Flora because I don't want it to get too crowded, but it is too good not to review. If you are looking for amazing, authentic, Italian food with a good wine, and a very quant atmosphere, this is your place! It is slightly pricey but totally worth the price. 
Everything we ordered was fantastic. 

Make reservations and be prepared you might need to wait a few minutes as it's a very small restaurant. 

Perfect North Beach Italian Gem!
author: Jessy B.

description:
I walked by this restaurant during the day many times and thought "what a cute, romantic restaurant, I need to have dinner here some time".  I wish I hadn't waited so long, what a gem this place is!!

The restaurant is small and quaint, a great spot for a date!   My husband and I had the gnocchi, the sol and the linguine with mussels, all were excellent!  You can tell that everything is home made and fresh.  When we ordered out meals, the waitress and owner (I believe) knew exactly what wine to pour.  This seems like a great neighborhood spot and I can't wait to taste more items on the menu.
author: stacy b.

description: Loved every minute of this evening....great food and wonderful ambience....
author: Heath P.

description:
There are a lot of reasons to love this place.  It's a real gem of SF. It's quaint and timeless and the women who own it are lovely. I brought my father (from Brooklyn) there last night and we had a lovely meal and time. Oh, and the wine list is impeccable. 

They serve complimentary foccacia that is out of this world. We started with the sweet potato gnocchi with bacon, a house specialty. Amazing. Also, a spiced coppa with white bean appetizer that was delicious! For mains I ordered the manicotti stuffed with sheep's milk ricotta and broccoli raab, with a garlic marinara  topped with provolone. He ordered a pork entree that I did not taste but probably should have. For dessert we ordered the plum crisp and strawberry ice cream. 

This is the kind of North Beach and italian food experience that I enjoy. Good wine, intimate atmosphere, with fresh seasonal and well prepared dishes. Drum up a conversation with Flora, she's a wealth of knowledge about wine, history, food etc.

Bon appetite!
author: michele s.

description: The best little Italian place off of Columbus street with a very romantic & intimate vintage library atmosphere. The service is excellent & staff is very attentive. Lots of locals dine here so you know is a nice place to visit. Recommend to make reservations as it is a small place.
author: Addy Z.

description:
Salad was caustic, main courses were boring and the service was atrocious. The two women that own the restaurant were the two servers. They got into some kind of disagreement and one of them sat down and read for over a half hour leaving tables waiting. They were abrupt and rude to our table but appeared very friendly and patronizing to tables of parties that they knew personally.

Quite honestly there are too many restaurants with much more to offer giving a pleasurable experience than to ever want to give these restauranteurs my money for an evening of misery.
author: Steven B.

description:
I don't normally complain about service as I am generally more interested in food but I couldn't ignore there poor attitude.  We walked in off the street and immediately felt unwelcome and that she was doing us a favour by "fitting" us in.  I thought in my head are we not good for our money.  When we were leaving she just ignored us even though we were thanking her for the food. The portents were small and very pricey although I did enjoy my crepes with veal.  My wife hated the sause on the sole.  It cost us $150 for 3 small meals and a bottle of wine. 

We won't be back.
author: Kevin M.

description:
They're not rude, they're just Venetian!  A limited, handwritten menu every night where certain items (e.g. lamb bolognese) are known to sell out.  Better than any tourist trap in North Beach.  Even rivals all those fancy neo-Italian restaurants in the rest of San Francisco.  Still dreaming about those sweet potato gnocchi...

Porchetta Tonnato: Cooler than room temperature slices of thin roast pork spread on a platter.  The sauce on top reminded me of tuna salad, but with much more mayo than tuna.  The capers worked well to cut the mayo's richness.  Pretty dang awesome.  Definitely broke my stereotype that the only good porchetta had to be piping hot and multi-textured like Roli Roti.

Sweet Potato Gnocchi: No wonder why people rave about this, it is friggin' awesome!  Little dumplings of savory sweet goodness in a creamy sauce of sage and BACON!  Splitting this amongst two people only yielded 3-4 gnocchis a person, far under served in my opinion! 

Amatriciana: This entrée did not exemplify their talents.  Firm penne in a somewhat bland tomato sauce.  The guanciale bacon added a fatty/smoky dimension, but still more was needed more to save the dish.  Thankfully there was a lot of grated parmesan on hand to make it tolerable.

Hungarian Pork: Last time I checked, there weren't many Hungarians in Venice.  Not sure how this dish got on the menu, but it was worth it!  A massive amount (more than you've ever had before in a single dish) of paprika in a red sauce.  The pork was slow roasted and fall apart tender.  Love how they used Italian dumplings (a.k.a. gnocchi) instead of that nasty starchy stuff they eat in Hungary.

Orange Cake w/ Huckleberries: I only ordered this dessert because they had fresh huckleberries.  Loads of them, so it did not disappoint.  The 'cake' was rather dense, but had a great strong citrus tone, like someone took candied peel essence and put it in a muffin.
author: Adam B.

description:
I must first admit that I've never eaten at the Da Flora Restaurant.  

I first heard about the place while watching a local TV show about local restaurants with the host interviewing three individuals (not professionals but people who enjoy eating out and do eat out regularly).  They gave the place high marks for both food and service.  I don't remember what any of the reviewers said about price.

I called a couple of times but the first 3 times, called in the early afternoon and got an answering machine.  Well, I never got a call back.  Strike 1

Then, I called in the evening and did get someone but they were too busy to answer any questions.  Strike 2

I called one more time at around 4pm and finally got a staff person  that took the time to answer  my questions regarding the menu. 

I use a wheelchair for mobility, so  I don't like being surprised, after having a drink before dinner, wine with dinner and maybe coffee after dinner, to find that there is no wheelchair accessible restroom that I can use.   Even after over 30 years since California Building Code requirements for accessibility were adopted and over 20 years since the Americans with Disabilities Act, a federal civil rights regulation adopted by Congress and signed into law by the first President Bush, those of us with (especially mobility) disabilities still find many (if not most) restaurants and public accommodations (businesses open to the public) that lack accessible paths-of-travel, accessible tables (typically the table bases block those of us using wheelchairs from having our laps under the table), and especially important, accessible bathrooms.

Well, after the menu questions were answered by the staff person, I asked my typical questions, "is your restaurant accessible and do you have an accessible bathroom?".  The person asked me to hold for a moment and another person came on the phone and asked what my question was, which I repeated.  She immediately yelled, "don't call here again!" AND HUNG UP ON ME!

I still don't know if Da Flora has an accessible bathroom that I could use but I won't be going there to find out.  There are too many outstanding restaurants to choose from  in the City.  I certainly don't need rude owners yelling at me because I want to know if their restaurant is accessible.  I hope you will join me in avoiding the joint!
author: Richard S.

description: Ok - this is tough as IT REALLY deserves 3.5 stars - not quite 4 as I just gave that to SPQR and reserve 5 for French Laundry types - second time here prior to seeing comedy show - good food, very, very nice service, but just not OUTSTANDING - prices insinuate a bit more to the food, however, still would come back.  Small and quaint with very friendly service - food is interesting but lacks that PUNCH one would expect - needs a bit more on simple seasonings like salt/pepper - quality of the food is great - the gnocchi is REALLY good and the ceaser was exceptional - the Manicotti was actually the best part of the meal which was layered in wonderful cream and basil sauce that complimented the rich, velvety interior of the manicotti itself!!
author: Richard D.

description:
I was taken to this restaurant by friends of mine who run their own restaurant and wine shop in town.  This is their favorite restaurant (besides their own, of course) and for good reason.  I let them do the ordering and everything we had was utterly fantastic.  The complimentary focaccia they serve is ridiculous!  And other's aren't lying when they say the sweet potato gnocchi is insane because it absolutely is. 

The most wonderful surprise was that my friend, who is a wine expert, let Flora (the owner) pick our wine for us.  She brought us two bottles of spectacular wines that paired with our food brilliantly.  Not only had I never had either of the wines but I sincerely loved them both.  Perfection!  Ask Flora for a recommendation and you can't go wrong.  This woman knows her stuff and has impeccable taste.  Can't wait to bring my other foodie and wine lover friends to this place..
author: Kelly S.

description: This is our favorite North Beach restaurant! Hands down! The food, the owners & the chef and her husband are the best! And the decor is fabulous. We always feel like we are dining with family at their house, in a good and warm way. We've eaten here MANY times and always can't wait until we return. I can't rave enough about this gem.
author: Katt D.

description:
My experience here was so good that it inspired me to join Yelp.

It doesn't look like much, and getting a reservation can be kind of frustrating, but:
-the sweet potato gnocchi
-the amatriciana
-the rigatoni with butternut squash
-the charmingly 'I'm in charge here' service--they kinda let you know from the get-go that you're best off ceding all responsibility to them

Words fail me, I guess.

Point being: food, wine, and service are great here, and you're best off approaching the experience with a sense of humor and adventure.  All aspects of the restaurant are unique and not just for the sake of being unique.
author: Ty M.

description:
++ chicken liver crepe w/ mushroom - 4 stars

+++ Pork chop with garbanzo bean puree - 5 stars

Service was good. The owner took our order and suggested a good wine. Food came out faster then i anticipated.

The chicken liver crepe appetizer was delicious, although I did think the egg flavor in the crepe was a bit much, the liver and mushrooms along with the sauce was pretty incredible.

The pork chop was cooked perfectly, and the puree was heaven.
author: Alyjaa S.

description:
Big fat five stars for this establishment.  Excellent service through and through.  Never felt rushed one bit.  Ordered three appetizers and a main course.  Server waited for us to finish each dish before bringing out the next.  She even brought new plates and utensils each time.  

Food was delicious.  Gnocchi was rich, chewy, and definitely tasty.  Fig and coppa combo should not be missed.  Seafood linguine was something you'd imagine your old italian grandma would prepare.  

Very cozy and quaint decor.  Lots of character.  Red interior covered with old Italian paintings and photos.  Felt very warm and comfortable.   

One warning...  they only pour one wine by the glass.  So if you want to drink a certain varietal, you will have to either bring your own bottle or order one of theirs. 

Otherwise, a real San Francisco prize.
author: Jasper J.

description:
Can't even give this restaurant one star - but this app is making me.  We live in the neighborhood and have been wanting to try this place for years.  Based on some great yelp reviews we finally planned and made reservations.  We were excited to try this local spot... 

Nothing was good about our experience.  Service was HORRIBLE!!  we were ignored, never asked if we wanted another glass of wine, the home made focaccia was not fully baked, our food was delivered barely warm... we didn't even try dessert because we didn't want to give this place any more business - BIG FAIL..
author: lisa w.

description:
This is a difficult place to review because the food  was hands down the best Italian food I've ever had , we didn't want to get a bottle of wine they don't have a list by the glass so I told Flora what I like, and she brought me exactly what I was hoping for, she knows her wines incredibly well .We had the bottarga and the sweet potato gnocchi , it was spectacular . 

Now , the service not the best but for some strange reason it didn't bother us because we can tell that , that is how they roll and if you don't like it don't go there, but the food was so amazing that we will go back!
author: Mrs. Bauman M.

description:
"They're not rude, they're just Venetian" - another reviewer wrote.  They didn't even come up to our table until we got up to leave because after sitting there for nearly 20 minutes, we couldn't get either of these women to ask us if we wanted a drink much less take our food order.  As we got up, one of the women (who had been chatting with a couple at another table for quite some time), had a somewhat shocked look on her face as we proceeded to exit.  She was totally unapologetic and didn't ask us why we were leaving.
I'd love to give a review on the food, but we didn't have any of it!  No excuse for this.  Unbelievable that these 2 women are the owners.  Why open a restaurant if you don't want to share your food with others?  Awful, awful, awful!
author: Abby H.

description:
Haven't been in years, but the extraordinarily pillowy sweet potato gnocchi has not left my memory banks.  Everything else, wine included, was also divine.

Da Flora has an inconspicuous exterior and is located in a bit of a sweet spot that is still central to North Beach to be convenient but just far enough beyond both NB and Fisherman's Wharf to avoid tourist crowds.  Probably also helps that they limit their hours.

There is a small parking lot/garage right across the street so no circling.  You can then enjoy an after-dinner stroll along Columbus, as the shops stay open late.
author: Elizabeth W.

description:
I've been fantasizing about Da Flora for years; we finally went for my birthday last weekend (my bf used to be a regular but hadn't been in years).  And the place did not disappoint.  You will be hard-pressed to find better, more authentic Italian food anywhere in the city.  Anywhere.

Escarole was light, delicately flavored, and a perfect start.  Sweet potato gnocchi next--this is a must.  Little pillows of freshly-made pasta & sweet potato absolutely melt in your mouth, and the pancetta adds a lovely stuffed baked potato note.  You'll want to save some of the wonderfully authentic focaccia for wiping up the leftover sauce.

Osso bucco was tender & succulent, served with roast tomatoes & whipped white bean (& also left plenty of juice for wiping up with bread), & duck paperadelli was spectacular.  The freshness of the pasta, the flavor of the perfectly cooked duck, and the delicate sauce (plus fresh Parmesan) were all perfect together.  Flora, of course, chose the perfect wine to accompany both dishes, a light, Southern red that was fruity, spicy, and earthy all at the same time.

For dessert, we had a chocolate cake with caramel, dark chocolate sauce, & toasted almonds and pears baked in a tart with mascarpone and honey.  Both were fantastic.  Again, Flora suggested the perfect dessert wine for each.

A $220 dinner when all was said & done, but absolutely worth every penny.

A few other notes about Da Flora:

1)  The place is small.  Get a reservation if you can.  If not, come early.  They close at 10, even on weekends.

2)  Allow plenty of time for your meal; this is not a good place to go if you're on a tight schedule.  Flora & Mary Beth serve dinner in the traditional Italian sense of the word, which means it can take multiple hours.  (We were there for two & a half.)

3)  The wine list is all small Italian wines that Flora herself selects when she visits Italy, and she knows them all insanely well.  Unless you're an expert in Italian wine (and maybe even then), just ask Flora for a recommendation.  She LOVES talking about her wines & what will go well with your food, taking into consideration a price point as well as what you like & are in the mood for.  (She is not above refusing to serve you a wine if she thinks it won't complement the food.)

4)  The vibe here is not unlike that of eating at someone else's house as a guest.  I promise you that if you behave accordingly, you will have a fabulous time, and if you don't, you may find yourself feeling somewhat less welcome.  (Some people who gave low reviews remarked on Flora & Mary Beth having their 'favorite' customers whom they dote upon.  I'm sure this is absolutely true.  You know who their favorites are?  People who conduct themselves with grace and class, and don't act like this is freaking Applebee's.)  These ladies have enough of a devoted cult following that they don't have to court customers who piss them off.

Sooooo worth it.  An absolute must if you like good Italian food & wine, & aren't a douchey boor.
author: Angela B.

description:
This is one of those places that helps you justify paying high rent in a big (and I mean "big") city because you're reminded that if you had to frequently dine in such whitewashed places as Irvine or Scottsdale, you'd want to jump off the Golden Gate (oh, wait, they put up that damned fence).
